[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/pox-2.clar] [Function: stack-stx()] [Amount Zero] Although minimal-can-stack-stx checks (> amount-ustx u0), can stacking with amount=1 ustx (well below minimum) still pass if the check happens when liquid supply is extremely low? (Low)

[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/pox-2.clar] [Function: stack-stx()] [Cycle Boundary] If stack-stx is called at the exact moment when burn-block-height transitions to a new cycle, can current-pox-reward-cycle return inconsistent values in different parts of the execution? [File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/pox-2.clar] [Function: stack-stx()] [Integer Overflow] If amount-ustx is near u128 max and multiple stackers stack to the same pox-addr, can reward-cycle-total-stacked overflow and wrap around? (High)

[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/pox-2.clar] [Function: delegate-stx()] [Amount Zero] Can amount-ustx be set to u0, creating a delegation that allows the delegate to stack any amount of the delegator's funds? (Critical)

[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/pox-2.clar] [Function: delegate-stx()] [Until Burn Height] If until-burn-ht is set to u0 or u1 (in the past), does this create an immediately expired delegation that passes initial checks but fails later? (Medium)

[File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/pox-2.clar] [Function: delegate-stx()] [POX Address Requirement] If pox-addr is set in delegation but delegate-stack-stx is called with a different address, the check at line 842 should fail - but does it correctly compare optional values? [File: stacks-core/stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/pox-2.clar] [Function: delegate-stx()] [Delegation Override] Can calling delegate-stx while already delegated to delegate-A immediately switch to delegate-B without revoking, potentially violating agreements? (Medium)
